wikipedia_page.main: John Mandell Keers (6 March 1901 – 5 January 1963) was an English professional footballer who played as an outside forward. Born in Tow Law, he played in the Football League for Hull City and Nelson, as well as representing several semi-professional clubs.

response: In the early years of the club's existence, Annfield Plain fielded a number of players who went on to play professionally in the Football League. Examples include John Keers, who was signed by Football League Third Division North side Nelson for a fee of £150 in 1926.
